segments.text: I see the woman at the sink, completely unaware of the water overflowing all over the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe she hasn't noticed the puddle forming at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like she's completely in her own world, unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are being so quiet, she probably hasn't noticed them either.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit frustrated watching her ignore the mess like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching into the cookie jar, and his sister is waiting for him to hand her one.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They seem to be working together, which is cute, but they're making a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope they don't make too much of a mess or get caught.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool he's standing on looks like it might tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe the woman hasn't noticed any of this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just a disaster waiting to happen, and it's making me feel a bit anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR
